title: How to Wear a Cross Body Bag

steps.title: Wear a bright bag with a dark outfit to make your bag stand out.
steps.content: Wear a bright bag with a dark outfit to make your bag stand out. This is a great way to accentuate the colours and patterns of your bag. For example, a yellow or turquoise bag would look great over a navy or black coat. This is perfect for casual occasions and can help to make your outfit look fun and cheerful. To create a similar look, wear a dark bag over a bright outfit.

steps.title: Opt for a chain strap if you want the pattern of your top to be visible.
steps.content: Opt for a chain strap if you want the pattern of your top to be visible. Cross-body bags with chain straps work well, as they don’t completely cover your shirt or jacket underneath. If you want a cohesive and streamlined look, this is a great option. Chain straps are a great option if you want your outfit to look a little more dressy.

steps.title: Choose a bag that’s the same colour as your top if you want it to blend in.
steps.content: Choose a bag that’s the same colour as your top if you want it to blend in. This is a great option if you are wanting a subtle and streamlined look. Choose a bag that has a strap and body that is a similar colour to your coat, dress or shirt. A navy blue bag over a navy blue dress or suit would be a great outfit to wear to a business event.

steps.title: Combine a patterned bag with a plain outfit for a balanced look.
steps.content: Combine a patterned bag with a plain outfit for a balanced look. This is a great option for both casual and formal outfits. For example, pair a striped cross-body bag with a red coat for a striking, formal look. Alternatively, you could wear a floral patterned bag with a black shirt for a fun, casual look. Wear a plain bag with a patterned outfit to create a similar look. Cross-body bags are great for casual days on the go. [1] X Expert Source Chloée Ohayon-Crosby Costume Designer & Wardrobe Specialist Expert Interview. 23 October 2020.

steps.title: Wear the bag over a loose-fitting outfit to accentuate your figure.
steps.content: Wear the bag over a loose-fitting outfit to accentuate your figure. The strap on your cross-body bag sits across your chest and pulls your shirt or dress toward your body. This showcases the shape of your body and can help to make your outfit more flattering. Wear the bag with any outfit that is a little more loose fitting than you want. For example, wear a red cross-body bag over an over-sized leather jacket for a fitted, grunge look. A cross-body bag with a dress can give you a more boho look. [2] X Expert Source Chloée Ohayon-Crosby Costume Designer & Wardrobe Specialist Expert Interview. 23 October 2020.

steps.title: Wear the cross-body bag at waist level for an on-trend look.
steps.content: Wear the cross-body bag at waist level for an on-trend look. This is a great option if you are wanting a high-fashion look. Shorten the straps on your cross-body bag so that it sits just above one of your hips. This position is handy if you want to be able to easily access the contents of your bag. Purchase a bag with adjustable straps from a department store, a specialist bag store, on-line or even a thrift shop or vintage retailer.

steps.title: Position your bag in front of you for easy access.
steps.content: Position your bag in front of you for easy access. To achieve this look, simply swivel the bag toward your belly button. Experiment with different placements until you find one that you like the look of and feels comfortable. This bag placement is particularly useful for when you are traveling or shopping and want to be able to quickly access your wallet and phone. This option works best on bags with steps that are waist length.

steps.title: Wear the bag around your hips for a traditional look.
steps.content: Wear the bag around your hips for a traditional look. This is the most popular way to wear a cross-body bag. To achieve this look, adjust the straps so that your bag sits on, or just under your hips. This positioning works with all outfits and is really comfortable.

steps.title: Position the bag at the back of your body to keep it out of the way.
steps.content: Position the bag at the back of your body to keep it out of the way. This is a good option if you don’t need to access the contents of your bag for a while. Simply swivel the bags around to your back and let the straps rest across your chest.> This positioning is most comfortable with waist-height bags.
